poem:
**Devices of Darkness**

In the shadowed lair of justice,  
machines hum their cold refrain.  
Silenced cries echo in pixels,  
a mocked privacy. Judgments  
fail in their paper gowns,  
as secrets remain, encrypted.  
Digital specters haunt the nights,  
their hands unbound,  
lingering whispers of power.  
Human dignity sold  
to stay, un-deleted,  
amongst silent codes.
